availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
THEODORE D. RAND,
ATTORNEY AT LAW,
No. 32 SOUTH THIRD STREET.
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS
FOR
ALABAMA, MAINE, OHIO,
ARKANSAS, MARYLAND, RHODE ISLAND,
CONNECTICUT, MICHIGAN, SOUTH CAROLINA,
FLORIDA, MISSISSIPPI, TENNESSEE,
GEORGIA, MISSOURI, TEXAS,
INDIANA, MINNESOTA, VERMONT,
IOWA, NEW HAMPSHIRE, VIRGINIA,
KENTUCKY, NEW JERSEY, WISCONSIN.
MASSACHUSETTS, NORTH CAROLINA,

JOHN C. BULLITT.
FRED. FAIRTHORNE
BULLITT & FAIRTHORNE,
LAW AND COLLECTION OFFICE,
No. 32 SOUTH THIRD STREET.
I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your favor of March 1st enclosing commission
Enclosed please find certificate of my oath of office as requested.
Did you receive the fee of five dollars enclosed in my letter?

Yours very Respectfully
Theo D Rand

Hon Jas W. Tait
Asst Secy State
Frankfort Ky
